ARABIC: قَالَ خُذْهَا وَلَا تَخَفْ سَنُعِيدُهَا سِيرَتَهَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'Take hold of it and have no fear. We will return it to its original form.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Catch it," said He, "and have no fear; We shall revert it to its former state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then He said: "Seize it and have no fear. We shall restore it to its former state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The Lord said, "Hold the serpent and do not be afraid; We will bring it back to its original form."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “Pick it up and do not fear; We shall restore it to its former state.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Allah said: "Grasp it and fear not; We shall return it to its former state."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: Take hold of it and fear not; We will restore it to its former state:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Said He, 'Take it, and fear not; We will restore it to its first state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: Grasp it and fear not. We shall return it to its former state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: God said, "Take hold of it, and have no fear: We shall return it to its former state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Allah said: take hold of it, and fear not; We shall restore it to its former state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘Take hold of it, and do not fear. We will restore it to its former state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Allah) said, "Seize it, and fear not: We shall return it at once to its former condition"..
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Allah said:"Grasp it, and fear not, We shall return it to its former state,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Take it, and do not fear' He said, 'We will restore it to its former state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “Take hold of it, and do not fear. We will restore it to its original condition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Allah] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:21] He said, ‘Take [hold of] it and do not fear, it. We will restore it to its former state (sīratahā, in the accusative because the genitive-operating preposition has been removed). And so he placed his hand in its mouth and it became a staff once again; and it became clear that the place into which he put his hand was the place where it [the staff] is held, between its two prongs. Moses was shown this [miracle] lest he be terrified when it turns into a snake in the presence of Pharaoh.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Allah said to him: (Grasp it) Moses (and fear not. We shall return it to its former state) a staff just as it was initially.
